column4: Hi, I am trying to install some packages using apt-get, but the jp.archive.ubuntu.com appears to be down.  Even after editing sources.list for aptitude, apt-get still trys reading from the jp mirror.  How do I solve this?  Thanks
after ediiting the file did you run sudo apt-get update?
are they commented out in the sources.list file?
cat /etc/apt/sources.list and then paste it to http://rafb.net/paste and then paste the URL back here
actually, just do this.  grep efgy-updates /etc/apt/sources.list
I'm still running the update, it is downloading some files, but it still keeps reporting errors with the jp mirror
its trying to connect to the jp mirrora gain
great.  if you still have issues check to see that you dont have files in /etc/apt/sources.list.d/
it's working.  Many thanks for your help
